item.title: Every day in Python AtCoder #44
item.description: ### Introduction Last time Solve 5 boot camp problems #44 ABC056-C Thoughts The sum of non-negative integers up to i is $\frac{1}{2}n(n+1)$}}. This sum becomes $X$ when $\frac{1}{2}n(n+1)=X$, and when solving for $n$, $n=\frac{-1\pm{ It will be \sqrt{8X+1}}}{2}$. If you add the ceil symbol to the solution of this equation, it becomes $\lceil \frac{-1\pm{\sqrt{8X+1}}}{2} \rceil$. This is the answer. import math x = int(input()) f = (-1+math.sqrt(8*x+1)) / 2 print(math.

item.title: Every day in Python AtCoder #41
item.description: ### Introduction Last time I have ABC today so I have only one question. #41 Problem Thoughts It’s a long-standing problem. When I tried to solve this time, I didn’t understand why I was having a difficult time. Since the range of the solution is small, check all with for.
